reviews.text: We booked this property for a one night stay prior to a cruise because it had gotten above average reviews here on Trip Advisor. I had reserved two rooms. One for myself and my husband (king) and one for my two teenage boys (doubles). Their internet reservation system did not allow me to put my kids in a room without an adult. I was concerned that the front desk was going to give me an issue about it too and we would have to play the "key switch game". They didn't give us any grief at check in at all. They even moved our rooms to be a little closer together. (They did not have anything adjoining, but at least they got us on the same floor.)
reviews.title: Excellent customer service

reviews.text: Our rooms were a little small, but they were clean and had lovely linens and comfy beds. Both of the rooms had a nice view, but the boys really scored with a view of the cruise ships. I enjoyed being able to sit out on my balcony and do my nails and watch people swimming in the pool while my husband took a quick nap.
reviews.title: Great views...but there were issues...
Average
reviews.text: We ate dinner at the hotel's restaurant. I can't remember what it was called, but it had a nice view of their marina and the food was passable hotel food. I had a good salad and my husband enjoyed his burger. Any time he can get one that's not burnt to a crisp, he's happy. My older son had pasta and thought it was good. I can't remember what my younger son ate, but he would have complained - loudly - if it had been bad.

The bell manager was also greatly helpful in tracking down the suitcase that Continental had sent off to Denver or some such nonsense. He stayed on top of things until it was delivered to the hotel... finally calling my room (as I'd requested) at 3 a.m. to let me know it had arrived safely.
reviews.title: Good hotel for business stays

reviews.text: We ate breakfast at the hotel again. Similar food quality. I can't speak for the buffet. I don't like them. Too germy. :)
reviews.title: friendly staff

reviews.text: I recently stayed at this hotel on a one night trip to miami to see a NBA Miami Heat Game. Perfect location for just that. The American Airlines Arena was a two minute drive away. The bridge to South Beach was two minutes away as well. The hotel was nice and modern. The only complaint that I have it that the tv went out out during the 4th quarter of the NFC Title game so I didnt get to see the end.
reviews.title: Nice Alternative to South Beach Hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel also has a little tunnel connected to it with a bar, restaurant and store that were very useful to me. I'd stay here again.
reviews.title: Good View, the rest, eh.

reviews.text: We stayed here the night before our cruise. We were greeted promptly, and off to our room we went. We had a room with a view and lovely balcony. Due to the balcony layouts, the rooms are oddly shaped.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised at View and Service

reviews.text: Pros-Great View
reviews.title: Outdated Marriott

reviews.text: -comfortable bed
reviews.title: Beautiful bay view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful. Of course its a little costly but its better to stay at a nice place than just anywhere. The staff is very helpful and very friendly. My only problem was that I didnt get the room I paid for. I booked the deluxe bay view on the concierge level/executive level, but was much lower. Other than that, its a great place. The beds are amazing and tooooo comfortable.
reviews.title: Nice Nice Nice
Front Desk Randy was Great to us
reviews.text: We flew a red-eye from Long Beach, CA to Ft Lauderdale, Fl on Jet Blue. We were tired upon early morning arrival and feared we would not be able to check into our hotel, but the Marriot Biscayne Bay gave us an early check it AND they upgraded our room to concierge level w/a gorgeous view of the Bay AND all the breakfast, snacks, coffee and bar items we could want from the Concierge lounge for free! Needless to say we had a great time there! It was clean, comfortable and lovely.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Three days later we drove to Key Largo and checked into the Azul Del Mar. We stayed in the Seaview King room which had a kitchen sink, microwave, fridge, dishwasher and dishes/utensils. The bathroom was small, but everything else was clean and spacious. Every morning a basket of warm pastries and yogurt arrived on our doorstep and we enjoyed them in bed or overlooking the ocean. We had dinner at the very busy Hobo's and it was ok. I would not eat at Captain "somethings" Fish and Chips shack--they would not let me bring my bottled water in even though I said I was pregnant and would only be drinking water. The "hostess" said they sold bottled water and I'd have to buy theirs. I wish I could remember the name of this "restaurant" that was promptly left. Tower of Pizza was pretty good.
reviews.title: Convenient, Spacious and Modern

reviews.text: Anyway, after enjoying John Pennekamp state park snorkeling, we drove back to South Beach and stayed at The Standard. That was a DUMP! The spa, pool and dining were nice, but the building and accommodations were not that clean or nice compared to their website. The front desk check-in service was sub par.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: Prior to flying back on an early flight, we spent one night at the Hilton Ft. Lauderdale Airport. It was affordable, clean, comfortable and convenient. Nice music by the pool, snacks in the lobby area and a 24hr complimentary airport shuttle.
reviews.title: A very satisfactory Miami hotel experience

reviews.text: stayed at the marriott biscayne bay prior to a cruise in may. stayed here the prior year for a cruise and service and amenities are still top notch. stayed on one of the upper floors had a great view of the bay. front desk personnel and restaurant personal were great. decent location rode the people mover to various stops in miami.
reviews.title: another great stay at the marriott

reviews.text: The price was right so that I cannot complain about. We wanted something that offered a shuttle to the port and that the Marriott did.
reviews.title: Nice precruise hotel
Very nice downtown hotel
reviews.text: When we arrived we had a view to the left of the port and couldnt see the ships. It basically was a view of the pools and some yachts. However still nice. The balcony was big and the window was HUGE!
No continental breakfast, free internet. There was a restuarant in the hotel and we ate there as soon as we checked in. Our
reviews.title: Fine place for a room

reviews.text: hamburgers were really good but wow, almost $10.00 for one!
reviews.title: Very Satisfied With This Hotel

reviews.text: Never did I expect to see manatees in the wild! From my balcony way up high, I could see the piers off to my right. Much to my surprise, I saw what appeared to be manatees in the water. I couldn't believe it. I thought my eyes must have deceived me because I was so high. An hour later, I went out to the balcony again and noticed that the shapes that I was guessing were manatees had moved. Now, convinced, I headed downstairs, down along the water and out to the last pier, where I recalled seeing them. I didn't see them in the water until I was almost on top of them on the pier. I stood there for quite a while enjoying them. Two other people came out saying that they had also seen them from their balconies. It was truly exciting and memorable and this alone made my stay at the Marriott Biscayne Bay wonderful!
reviews.title: Manatees!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although not at South Beach, the hotel is convenient to the beaches and local sites, but far enough away, that it feels isolated. At night, you can sit outside the bar on benches and enjoy the breeze and a good cocktail --- this was in January when everyone at home was freezing.
reviews.title: review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool isn't anything to write home about, but, it's adequate. There's a pool bar and fitness center and a friendly front desk staff. The pool also has a hot tub - yea!
reviews.title: good way to start to the honneymoon

reviews.text: The only bad part of the experience is that there is no wireless internet in the rooms. It's bad enough that internet is not included in the room. But, wired. Only wired! WTH?! I brought my Kindle Fire and could not use it in my room. What a waste. How is this a modern hotel? I felt like I was in some third world country! There is wireless internet in the lobby. But, I didn't want to hang out in the lobby.
reviews.title: Great rooms, wonderful service !

reviews.text: Rooms are OK.
reviews.title: Great Bay Views

reviews.text: This hotel was just amazing. Everything from the room - which had an amazing view of the bay and the greatest beds I've ever slept in - to the friendly and helpful staff. The location is also great, and the hotel is very close to the Port of Miami, which was ideal for us since our stay was pre-cruise.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't think of anything bad to say about this hotel. If you're looking for a place to stay in Miami, _stay at the Marriott_.
reviews.title: Very nice pre-cruise stay

reviews.text: Got a deal on Priceline for a pre-cruise stay. Easy cab ride from the airport. Beautiful lobby and friendly front desk staff. Location felt secure and safe although we didn't venture out into the local neighborhood. There is a small shopping plaza between the hotel and the Doubletree next door with restaurants, wine shop, and a small convenience store. Our "city view" room actually had a nice view of the Bay off to the side. We had a corner room with a small balcony. The room was quite spacious and typical furnishings for remodeled Marriotts. Love the comfy beds! The location wouldn't be something I'd pick for a whole vacation in Miami since there's not much nearby, but it would be great for business downtown or a one or two night stay. Cab ride to the port was quick and easy the next morning. Only drawbacks seem to be no wi-fi in the roooms (it's free in the lobby) and that the restaurants seem overpriced - even for Miami. The ones next door are much more reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I most say that is a great hotel, perfect rooms and fantastic location, However, the service just get better and better. I normally stay in this hotel " my home in Miami" around 6 times a year and the level of service is great. Last time Megan from front desk was very helpful, on some documents I needed, as well as Pedro or "Junior" from the valet, always available and willing to help with small details that make you feel at home.
reviews.title: Beautiful view for the 4th Fireworks or NYE

reviews.text: My husband took me here for my birthday and we had a suite overlooking the bay. It is very spacious and it's a very nice hotel. This is also a perfect spot to watch the fireworks, which we did on the 4th of July here as well. The service is always top notch and they want to make sure you enjoy your stay. All of the staff are very friendly. The downsides are $26 a day to park (there is no other option), and $9 bottle waters! I think both of those prices are a bit too much, even for Miami.
reviews.title: Good location and facilities

reviews.text: Stayed here for just one night; booked 2 rooms well in advance. Upon checking in, was told "rooms weren't ready yet". Ok- this was at 3pm. Upon returning at 5, was AGAIN told rooms were not ready! Uh, no- check in is 4pm, for starters... other people were checking in left & right... not to mention the fact I had my 80 year old father in law with us! After asking to speak to a manager... she said "No problem"... and *magically* 2 rooms were available! Staff about the hotel were friendly. GREAT view of the bay...the boats... Rooms were clean & comfortable. Be warned, this hotel is NOT within walking distance to most any "attractions".... Bayside Marketplace is a $7 cab ride away. All in all, eh....just ok- I would definately not give this Marriott another shot though... not at those prices!
reviews.title: Good but I expected better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After travelling 19 hours from northern Europe and excited about the following day's first ever cruise the competent check-in service was most soothing. Our luggage was out of the cab in no time by the valet and the actual check-in was equally effective and friendly. Our reservation was double and we were offered the choice of double king or two twins. We were happy to choose the latter in the 19th floor with spectalular view of the Port of Miami with Miami Beach in the background. What a way to start the cruise by waking up early in the morning with unobstructed views of your cruise ship! The price didn't include breakfast which we had anyway by choosing the excellent but somewhat pricy breakfast buffet. The location 2 miles from the port coudn't be better with cabs ready in the courtyard.
reviews.title: Great pre-cruise night for first-timers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed there Jan 15-17, 2012.....The first room smelled like a sewer. They moved us to another room where the toilet did not flush. When we checked out I left three new shirts in the room. we called the hotel the next day and they said they found no shirts. Two days later I called again from my cruise ship and demanded the manager. I insisted they look in the first room and, voila, they found the shirts......too late to use on the cruise, which is the reason I had bought them. So my overall opinion is that the hotel has lax management.
reviews.title: poor management

reviews.text: Our room was on the 5th floor pool level. We had a slider open to a patio with chairs and table nice for evening cocktails and relaxing. This patio provided access to the pool area. The pool seemed small for the size of the property. The fitness room was also conveniently located on the 5th floor. The fitness equipment was in good shape and the room offered a nice view. The staff was courteous. The bathroom seemed a little cramped. Wifi is not free; flat screen TV's in the room. The King bed was very comfortable and lots of pillows. The Catch Bar & Grill was pricy for the quality of the food which I would rate as average. The location is excellent to cab anywhere.
reviews.title: Good base of operations

reviews.text: Nice hotel, lovely views. Rooms are spacious and clean . No beach but nice pol and right on the bay
reviews.title: lovely views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are Marriott Rewards members, but normally are in the Fairfield or Courtyard price range. But, we were coming home from a cruise out of the Miami port, and wanted to treat ourselves.
reviews.title: Stumbled Early, But Worked Hard To Make Amends

likes.liked: — What's not to like. We had a great view and a great room
likes.disliked: — Having to pay for internet use and printing

reviews.text: We booked online through the Marriott site and my rewards number, finding a package for "pre or post" cruisers which included transportation and breakfast. But, just to be sure, I called the hotel a couple of weeks before the trip to find out how they would pick us up at the port (we were first time cruisers). I had to go through two front desk people who didn't understand that we were staying at the end of the cruise and needed to be picked up at the port before I finally got to a customer service rep, named Julisa, and we got it straightened out. It seems most folks use this package when leaving for a cruise rather than at the end.
reviews.title: Super Great Hotel!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also had a minor glitch on the rate. Julisa seemed confused about the rate I had booked, but I informed her about the code and where I saw it on the site. I also reminded her nicely that I was a Marriott Rewards member, but could just as easily "cross the street" to Hilton or somebody else if there was a problem. She said there were some errors in rate codes on the site, but they would glady honor the rate for what we needed.
reviews.title: Average Amenities

likes.disliked: — Not enough amenities, no free internet, fridge, microwave, etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: WIth little hesitation, she was able to get things straighted out, let me know how to get transporation from the port (just call and a bellman picked us up) and she said she would arrange to block a room out so we could check in early since our cruise was returning around 8 a.m.
reviews.title: Not what I expected

likes.liked: — The bell service and the view from our room
likes.disliked: — That they actually charged me for a room upgrade they did not provide

reviews.text: There we no problems when we actually arrived in port on July 27. We called as soon as we had our luggage and we had a limo at the curb within 15 min. The bellman who was driving was very helpful and advised us about a 3 hour city tour if we were interested (we were) and he could help arrange it.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended
